job_description:
Overview

Position Summary

The Vice President (VP) of Sales Enablement is a strategic leadership role reporting into the EVP of Sales and responsible for designing, implementing, and overseeing initiatives that empower and support the sales team to achieve their targets effectively. This role sits at the intersection of sales and marketing demand generation and involves developing and executing programs to enhance the productivity, efficiency, and overall revenue achievement of the sales organization. This role includes the following details for the VP of Sales Enablement

Responsibilities
• Collaboration and Alignment: working with executive leadership to formulate and manage overall business objectives.
• Oversee end-to-end Performance: responsibilities include looking after the development of current and new enablement initiatives. This includes programmatic design of programs in support of reporting roles while paving the way for successful delivery of revenue.
• Onboarding & Training program: responsible for evaluating onboarding process and making improvements to include writing, documenting, training, and managing.
• Process Improvement: review and enhancement of sales to revenue process along with gap analysis to streamline the process, with the goal of continuously optimizing existing approaches. Delivering best practices along with supporting the curation of sales collateral, tools, and resources that align with the buyer's journey.
• Facilitation of Alignment: Serving as the connective tissue that holds team members together. Gather insights and collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute initiatives that improve existing sales processes, with alignment to broader company goals.
• Metrics and Measurement: prudence in tracking sales enablement metrics and KPIs vital to the growth and success of the sales enablement team members and functions. Being able to demonstrate the business impact of their enablement efforts can lead to stakeholder buy-in and support for future endeavors, while also establishing trust between the revenue-facing team members served.
• Development: Continuous development both role and professionally for all team members. Developing and facilitating the metrics on a daily, weekly, monthly, annual basis with each team members to ensure clear alignment of job role achievement.
• Critical Thinking: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Exercising sound independent judgment.

Qualifications
• Evaluate, implement, and optimize sales enablement technologies and tools, such as CRM systems, sales automation, and analytics platforms.
• Understanding and managing the use of SalesForce.com with each of the team members as necessary. Master of the tools in the sales/marketing tech stack, and ability to communicate functionality while also designing initiatives that support adoption and track usage.
• Stay abreast of emerging technologies that can improve sales effectiveness.
• Project management, managing multiple projects at the same time with excellent execution management with success and hand off to the appropriate stakeholders.

Performance Metrics and Analytics
• Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for sales enablement and regularly measure and report on the impact of enablement programs and roles.
• Use data and analytics to identify areas for improvement and adjust strategies accordingly.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with marketing, product, IT, operations, and other cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between sales and other departments.
• Foster a culture of collaboration and knowledge-sharing.

Leadership and Team Management
• Recruit, develop, and lead a high-performing sales enablement team.
• Provide coaching and mentorship to team members, fostering professional growth.
• Continuous upskilling: Stay informed about industry trends, sales methodologies, and best practices in sales enablement.
• Continuously assess and evolve sales enablement strategies based on feedback and changing business needs.

Qualifications
• 5 years or more Sales and/or Sales enablement experience with excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
• Data-driven, analytical mindset with the ability to use data to drive decisions.
• Leadership and team management experience.
• Experience in sales enablement, revenue-facing roles, sales training, or sales support, and a demonstrated knowledge of best practices, methodologies, and technologies in each of these areas
• Measurable experience with having a positive impact on business outcomes, such as win rate, quota attainment, length of sales cycle, etc.
• Experience in executing change management initiatives with established approaches.
